sen.j: 藤原 致忠（ふじわら の むねただ、生没年未詳）は、平安時代中期の貴族。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Munetada (date of birth and death unknown) was a court noble during the mid Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Munetada (year of birth and death unknown) was a court noble during the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: fixed year details to match the word list
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Munetada (year of birth and death unknown) was a court noble during the mid Heian period.
He was the son of FUJIWARA no Motokata, who was a dainagon (a chief councilor of state).
He was the son of FUJIWARA no Motokata, who was a Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
sen.cmt: capitalized "Dainagon" and fixed to match the word list
sen.e: He was the son of FUJIWARA no Motokata, who was a Dainagon (chief councilor of state).
Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade)
He held the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: added "He held the rank of" to make this a sentence and added a period
sen.e: He held the rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).

sen.j: 蔵人、備後国守、右馬頭、京職などを歴任。
sen.e: He served as Kurodo (Chamberlain), Governor of Bingo Province, Uma no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses), Kyoshiki (the Capital Bureau) among others.
Among other posts, Munetada served as Kurodo (Chamberlain), Governor of the Bingo Province, Uma no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses), and Kyoshiki (the Capital Bureau).
sen.cmt: moved "among others" to the beginning of the sentence; changed "He" to "Munetada" since this is a new paragraph
sen.e: Among other posts, Munetada served as Kurodo (Chamberlain), Governor of Bingo Province, Uma no kami (Captain of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses), and Kyoshiki (the Capital Bureau).
sen.cmt: Governor of the Bingo Province の the を削除しました。

sen.j: 永延2年（988年）、息子の保輔が強盗の首領として朝廷から追捕宣旨を下された際、父親である致忠も拘禁された。
sen.e: In 988, when his son, Yasusuke, was captured by the Imperial court for being the chieftain of a group of robbers, Munetada, being his father, was also arrested.
When his son, Yasusuke, was captured by the Imperial court in 988 for being the chieftain of a group of thieves, as his father, Munetada was also arrested.
sen.cmt: robbers→thieves; changed position of the year and fixed grammar to sound more natural
sen.e: When his son, Yasusuke, was captured by the Imperial court in 988 for being the chieftain of a group of thieves, as his father, Munetada was also arrested.

sen.j: 長保元年（999年）橘惟頼及びその郎等を殺害した罪で佐渡国に流された。
sen.e: In 999, he was exile to Sado Province being charged with murder of Koreyori TACHIBANA and his followers.
In 999, Munetada was exiled to Sado Province after being charged with the murder of Koreyori TACHIBANA and his followers.
sen.cmt: changed "he" to "Munetada" since it was potentially ambiguous; exile→exiled; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: In 999, Munetada was exiled to Sado Province after being charged with the murder of Koreyori TACHIBANA and his followers.

sen.j: 薫物の名手としても知られた。
sen.e: He was also known for his expertise in blending incense.
He was also known for his expertise in blending incense.
He was also known for his expertise in blending incense.
